The automobile (Daimler, 1885) and the airplane (Wright brothers, 1903) further transformed land and air travel.  In communication, the Penny Postal Service (1840) made letter delivery affordable and widespread.  The telegraph (Samuel Morse, 1844) enabled faster message transmission, and the invention of the radio (Guglielmo Marconi, 1895) and television (John Logie Baird) drastically changed communication, boosting trade and commerce.
